co.paralleluniverse.fibers.futures

Class AsyncCompletableFuture<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.paralleluniverse.fibers.FiberAsync<V,Void,ExecutionException>
      • co.paralleluniverse.fibers.futures.AsyncCompletableFuture<V>

  • public class AsyncCompletableFuture<V>
extends FiberAsync<V,Void,ExecutionException>

    Turns CompletableFutures into fiber-blocking operations.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

        public static <V> V get(jsr166e.CompletableFuture<V> future)
             throws ExecutionException,
                    InterruptedException,
                    SuspendExecution

        Blocks the current strand (either fiber or thread) until the given future completes, and returns its result.

        Parameters:
        future - the future
        Returns:
        the future’s result
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - if the future’s computation threw an exception
        InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting
        SuspendExecution

      • get

        public static <V> V get(jsr166e.CompletableFuture<V> future,
        long timeout,
        TimeUnit unit)
             throws ExecutionException,
                    InterruptedException,
                    SuspendExecution,
                    TimeoutException

        Blocks the current strand (either fiber or thread) until the given future completes - but no longer than the given timeout - and returns its result.

        Parameters:
        future - the future
        timeout - the maximum duration to wait for the future’s result
        unit - the timeout’s time unit
        Returns:
        the future’s result
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - if the future’s computation threw an exception
        TimeoutException - if the timeout expired before the future completed
        InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting
        SuspendExecution

        Timeout timeout)
             throws ExecutionException,

                    SuspendExecution,
                    TimeoutException

        Blocks the current strand (either fiber or thread) until the given future completes - but no longer than the given timeout - and returns its result.

        Parameters:
        future - the future
        timeout - the method will not block for longer than the amount remaining in the Timeout
        Returns:
        the future’s result
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - if the future’s computation threw an exception
        TimeoutException - if the timeout expired before the future completed
        InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting
        SuspendExecution

      • getNoSuspend

        public static <V> V getNoSuspend(jsr166e.CompletableFuture<V> future)
                      throws ExecutionException,
                             InterruptedException

        Blocks the current strand (either fiber or thread) until the given future completes, and returns its result.

        Unlike get, while this is a fiber-blocking operation, it is not suspendable. It blocks the fiber by other, less efficient means, and get should be generally preferred over this method.

        Parameters:
        future - the future
        Returns:
        the future’s result
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - if the future’s computation threw an exception
        InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting

                             InterruptedException,
                             TimeoutException

        Blocks the current strand (either fiber or thread) until the given future completes - but no longer than the given timeout - and returns its result.

        Unlike get, while this is a fiber-blocking operation, it is not suspendable. It blocks the fiber by other, less efficient means, and get should be generally preferred over this method.

      • getNoSuspend

        public static <V> V getNoSuspend(jsr166e.CompletableFuture<V> future,
                 Timeout timeout)
                      throws ExecutionException,
                             InterruptedException,
                             TimeoutException

        Blocks the current strand (either fiber or thread) until the given future completes - but no longer than the given timeout - and returns its result.

        Unlike get, while this is a fiber-blocking operation, it is not suspendable. It blocks the fiber by other, less efficient means, and get should be generally preferred over this method.

        Parameters:
        future - the future
        timeout - the method will not block for longer than the amount remaining in the Timeout
        Returns:
        the future’s result
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - if the future’s computation threw an exception
        TimeoutException - if the timeout expired before the future completed
        InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting

      • requestAsync

        protected Void requestAsync()
        Description copied from class: FiberAsync

        A user of this class must override this method to start the asynchronous operation and register the callback. This method may return an attachment object that can be retrieved later by calling FiberAsync.getAttachment(). This method may not use any ThreadLocals.

        Specified by:
        requestAsync in class FiberAsync<V,Void,ExecutionException>
        Returns:
        An object to be set as this FiberAsync’s attachment, that can be later retrieved with FiberAsync.getAttachment().

      • requestSync

        protected V requestSync()
                 throws InterruptedException,
                        ExecutionException
        Description copied from class: FiberAsync

        Called if FiberAsync.run() is not being executed in a fiber. Should perform the operation synchronously and return its result. The default implementation of this method throws an IllegalThreadStateException.

        Overrides:
        requestSync in class FiberAsync<V,Void,ExecutionException>
        Returns:
        The operation’s result.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
        ExecutionException
